extendedIngredients.name: ham
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups chopped ham (leftover ham or deli ham works great here)
metaInformation: ( ham or deli ham works great here)

extendedIngredients.name: shredded cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups shredded cheese (Swiss, Cheddar..options are limitless)

recipes.title: Savory Spiral Stuffed Rolls
recipes.instructions: Follow the recipe for your roll dough until the dough has risen. Punch down the dough and roll the dough out into a large rectangle about 1/2-inch thick (using the french bread roll recipe, I rolled my dough to about 13 inches by 17 inches).In a small bowl, cream together the butter and cream cheese. Spread the rolled out dough with the butter/cream cheese mixture. Top with the ham, broccoli, cheese, Parmesan cheese, and green onions (see the pictures below). Roll the dough up, pinching the seam to seal. Slice the roll into about 1-inch segments. Place the rolls on a lightly greased baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap. Let the rolls rise until nearly doubled and bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes, until lightly browned and bubbly.

steps.step: Follow the recipe for your roll dough until the dough has risen. Punch down the dough and roll the dough out into a large rectangle about 1/2-inch thick (using the french bread roll recipe, I rolled my dough to about 13 inches by 17 inches).In a small bowl, cream together the butter and cream cheese.
Spread the rolled out dough with the butter/cream cheese mixture. Top with the ham, broccoli, cheese, Parmesan cheese, and green onions (see the pictures below).
Roll the dough up, pinching the seam to seal. Slice the roll into about 1-inch segments.
Place the rolls on a lightly greased baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap.
Let the rolls rise until nearly doubled and bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes, until lightly browned and bubbly.
